tldr: The article discusses various stripping voltammetry techniques, including anodic stripping voltammetry (ASV) and cathodic stripping voltammetry (CSV), for the determination of trace metals and organic species in environmental samples. The authors highlight the advantages of using hanging mercury drop electrode (HMDE) and mercury film electrode (MFE) in ASV and CSV, as well as the versatility of the method in determining various metal ions and organic species at low concentrations.
